The only way this exception can happen is if the Device.dispose() was called previously.    
This would normally happen only when Eclipse is exiting, so some other exception must 
have happened before.  Actually, maybe this exception is old and is not related to the 
crash. 

Are you able to reproduce this? If so, could you add here the contents of the Mac 
console.log after reproducing it.

I am not able to reproduce this, prefs work perfectly now.
 
This happened after moving from a previous integration release to this one - I simply moved the 
workspace into the new install (which was the same location as the old one).

The console log doesn't show anything happening (in eclipse) prior to the crash.
